body_html:
Can you get a stack trace?
You should have a crash report file created in a file like below during
crash

~/Library/Logs/DiagnosticReports/Python_2016-07-21-144526_Yaroslavs-MacBook-Pro.crash
(Also viewable under User Diagnostic reports in Console App)

Also you get a stack trace for crashing script.py on Mac by running under
lldb, ie

lldb python
(lldb) r script.py
....
(lldb) up
...
(lldb) up

Optionally compile with "bazel build -c dbg --config=cuda" to get actual
line numbers in stack trace

On Thu, Aug 11, 2016 at 2:49 AM, Ojas Shirekar notifications@github.com
wrote:

Okay I did what you said @yaroslavvb https://github.com/yaroslavvb.
Disabled SIP, now I get this:
import tensorflow
I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:108] successfully opened CUDA
library libcublas.7.5.dylib locally
I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:108] successfully opened CUDA
library libcudnn.5.dylib locally
I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:108] successfully opened CUDA
library libcufft.7.5.dylib locally
Segmentation fault: 11

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
#3723 (comment),
or mute the thread
https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AABaHFjRGTIRj4khKcTtOqawrorljwF2ks5qevAtgaJpZM4Jg1CN
.

body:
Can you get a stack trace?
You should have a crash report file created in a file like below during
crash

~/Library/Logs/DiagnosticReports/Python_2016-07-21-144526_Yaroslavs-MacBook-Pro.crash
(Also viewable under User Diagnostic reports in Console App)

Also you get a stack trace for crashing script.py on Mac by running under
lldb, ie

lldb python
(lldb) r script.py
....
(lldb) up
...
(lldb) up

Optionally compile with "bazel build -c dbg --config=cuda" to get actual
line numbers in stack trace

On Thu, Aug 11, 2016 at 2:49 AM, Ojas Shirekar notifications@github.com
wrote:

> Okay I did what you said @yaroslavvb https://github.com/yaroslavvb.
> Disabled SIP, now I get this:

> I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:108] successfully opened CUDA
> library libcublas.7.5.dylib locally
